answers.answer: Take him back to get more tests done. Are they like bruises? Are they raised, itchy?? Anything like that?

In googling the antibiotic,  I came up with this on the  list of SEVERE (requiring immediate attention) side effects: "purple patches under the skin".I think I'd call the doctor ASAP.http://www.drugs.com/sfx/sulfamethoxazole-trimethoprim-side-effects.html
BTW - have you had him tested for diabetes?  It really sounds like they tried to locate an infection and there wasn't one.Painful and frequent urination are symptoms of untreated diabetes.

question: My 5 yr old has been having to pee a lot and some pain, so I took him in, 3 different times, test run and no infection, no kidndey infection, blood work done, no infection, culture ran, no infection. Ask to put him on an antiobiotic( sulfamethoxazole), he finished the medicine, now he is has gotten some brow spots that appeared on his leg about 2". He seems to be tired lately. I am not sure what to do?
title: Brown spots on 5 year old son's leg
